I just upgrate from 3.1 beta to 3.2.3 to 3.3 beta 1. I have notice that 3.3 performance is better that prior release, However we have jsp programs which was working on 3.2. 3 and 3.1 is not working right.Here is the problem We're facing test10.jsp is the main program which have only one input with value "UPDATE" name ="action"
after submit this program will post it to test11.jsp for processing. In test11 , parameter action have change it to "New". <% String action = request.getParameter("action"); action = "New"; if (action.equals("New")||action.equals("Edit")) { System.out.println(" forward page "+ action); %> <% } %> after that it will redirect it to another program test12.jsp. In Test12.jsp ,request.getParameter("action") return "UPDATE" <% String action = request.getParameter("action"); System.out.println("action12:"+action); %>
testing <% } else { %> <% } %>
<% if (action.equals("New")) { %> New update
The workaround is change the parameter name with difference name, However we have few hundred programs to change it could cause another problem.

text:
The workaround is to do pageContext.setAttribute("action", action ) after 
you change the value. It's strange - I don't think this worked on 3.2.3.

I'll implement a fix in jasper34, it is already on my todo list.

I tried the test case below, but changed the beginning of test12.jsp to
have:

    <%
    String actions[] = request.getParameterValues("action");
    for (int i = 0; i < actions.length; i++)
        System.out.println("Action " + i + "=" + actions[i]);
    String action = actions[0];
    %>

For me it displays:

    Action 0=New
    Action 1=Update

and the button on the page displays "New".  As far as I can tell, this
is correct operation.  If there is still a problem, please test against
the latest Tomcat 3.3.x and log a new bug.
